In India there is an enormous gap between healthcare supply and demand. What do you think are the major steps that can be taken by the government to improve patient care in the country?

            I belive that there is an enormous gap between healthcare supply and demand.

            In India we are finding many complaints regarding health issues. Daily on tv, news papers we are finding people complaining that they are not receiving  proper treatment what they have to receive. Even yesturday i.e,(31-1-2014) because of gass leckage at government hospital lifes of many children were under risk.

          We even find complaints regarding diseases that are caused and spread by mosquitoes, such as, maleria, dengue, etc. This can be easily prevent by taking proper care. Government should take measures shuch as, providing mosquitoe mats for free to poor people, seeing that medicine used to kill mosquito is spread regulorly at places where complaints for the diseases caused by mosquitoes are more. Medical camp should be conducted regulorly at such places.

          Government hospitals should provide all the facilities required by the patients. Because of shortage of beds in governemnt hospitals we can find people sleeping on the floor, toilets smelling very badly, shortage of medicines, untidy rooms. Demand for beds is always remaining higher than the supply. This gap must be removed by tacking proper measures.

           We don't even find doctors reporting to hospital on time. We find many people are deying as they are not receving medication on proper time. On my personal experiance, once when i went to fever hospital i found that 128 people are waiting for one doctor. That means one doctor is being demanded by 128 people. After consulting doctor i again found a big line at medical shop. After waiting for long hours when my turn has come, the person at the cabin said that "medicies are finished. come tomarrow". 

           Measures such as appoiting a person to check regulorly for the availability of medicines, arranging a temporory doctor when patients count is more, seeing that all the doctors are reporting on time and late commers are punished, maitaining rooms in proper way must be taken.

           A surway must be done about the complaints the doctors receice on daily basis. If complaints are mostly from a particulor area about a particulor disease, then medical camps must be conducted.  Medicines required to cure the disease must be ordered on before hand. Hospital management should see that all the facilities to cure such a disease must be provided.

          Finally i conclude that, by conducting surveys, medical camps we can know what would be the demand and measures can be taken to meet the demand. Medicines which can prevent the disease must be supplied to the areas where the disease may spread. Prevention is always better than cure. Funds alloted for medicalcare must be utilised properly to meet the demand.
